@ewencp, I'm OK with reducing the priority and removing the "fix version". The original thinking for increasing the priority is the change we made to return `UnknownTopicOrPartition` in case the user is not authorized to describe the topics. Given feedback so far though, it seems that it's not as bad as I thought it would be.

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-pr-jdk8-scala2.11/908/
Test FAILed (JDK 8 and Scala 2.11).

@ewencp Thank you for the review. Since we are only adding one test (apart from the minimal sanity test) for each new mechanism, replication test felt like a good one since it does a few authentications during restarts. To reduce the time, I am using SCRAM-SHA-256 for client and SCRAM-SHA-512 for inter-broker. So that should test the two protocols as well as the co-existence of both protocols with just one test.
This was done in KAFKA-4158.
Closing PR since this is out of date now.
@junrao could you please take another look? This is a fix we'd love to have in 10.2 thx!

@enothereska, the test I had in mind is to verify that `MetricConfig` had the right recording level if the broker config is set. That is what has changed in this PR. Before this PR, the information was not propagated to that class. I agree that the sensor tests are the right place to verify that the recording level is used in the right way.
@guozhangwang @mjsax @enothereska

@kawamuray, to make it work with Java 9, something like the following would be needed:

https://github.com/apache/lucene-solr/commit/7e03427fa14a024ce257babcb8362d2451941e21

After thinking about it some more, we should stick with the simple solution in this PR for 0.10.2.0. I added a comment about the more complex solution required for Java 9 to https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KAFKA-4501.

Hi @dhwanikatagade thanks for the patch. 
The source folders in core are now correct.
I see that you have made the eclipse compiled classes location match the ones used by gradle on the CLI. 

However two generated Eclipse projects (`core` and `streams`) still have a mistake.

Their generated classpaths still include as _library_ entries the output directories of other projects they depend on. they should not

e.g. for `core` these library entries must not be there 
```
	<classpathentry kind="lib" path="/Users/ecomar/devel/ws-scratch/kafka/clients/build/classes/test"/>
	<classpathentry kind="lib" path="/Users/ecomar/devel/ws-scratch/kafka/clients/build/resources/test"/>
``` 
because the classpath already (correctly) contains this 

```
<classpathentry kind="src" path="/clients"/>
```

and similarly for the `streams` project these must not be present:
```
	<classpathentry kind="lib" path="/Users/ecomar/devel/ws-scratch/kafka/clients/build/classes/test"/>
	<classpathentry kind="lib" path="/Users/ecomar/devel/ws-scratch/kafka/clients/build/resources/test"/>
	<classpathentry kind="lib" path="/Users/ecomar/devel/ws-scratch/kafka/core/build/classes/test"/>
	<classpathentry kind="lib" path="/Users/ecomar/devel/ws-scratch/kafka/core/build/resources/test"/>
```

because the `streams` project already depends also on `core` and `clients` and it correctly has 
```
	<classpathentry kind="src" path="/clients"/>
	<classpathentry kind="src" path="/json"/>
	<classpathentry kind="src" path="/api"/>
	<classpathentry kind="src" path="/core"/>

```
